meanings.definition: relating to the study of the behavior of earth materials
meanings.sent1: The geotechnical report analyzed the soil composition for the building project.
meanings.sent2: Engineers conducted geotechnical tests to understand how the ground would react.
meanings.sent3: The geotechnical experts joked that the dirt had a lot to say about its own behavior.
meanings.sent4: The geotechnical nature of the ground beneath our feet determines the stability of structures.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the geotechnical properties of the land is crucial for safe construction.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the engineering properties of soil and rock
meanings.sent1: The geotechnical survey revealed the strength of the bedrock below.
meanings.sent2: Geotechnical engineers assess the stability of slopes and foundations.
meanings.sent3: The geotechnical characteristics of the soil made it ideal for building strong foundations.
meanings.sent4: The geotechnical makeup of the terrain influenced the design of the retaining wall.
meanings.sent5: Proper understanding of geotechnical aspects ensures the durability of structures.

meanings.definition: involving the analysis of geological factors in construction projects
meanings.sent1: The geotechnical study considered the impact of seismic activity on the site.
meanings.sent2: Geotechnical investigations help in identifying potential risks during construction.
meanings.sent3: The geotechnical team discovered unexpected fossils while examining the site.
meanings.sent4: Geotechnical evaluations play a crucial role in ensuring project safety.
meanings.sent5: Geotechnical assessments provide valuable insights into the geological challenges ahead.
